result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin R. Coyle

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Matter set for a P/S on 12/16/2022 at 11:00 a.m.
Status Report from JusticePoint dated 08/19/22

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:31 PM Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin R. Coyle in court.  Attorney (Atty) Taylor O Soule in court for Justin R. Coyle. 
ADA Pfeil calls witness, Officer K. Jolin, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.
Cross exam by Atty Soule.
No further questions.
BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 22, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Violation Report. Filed by JusticePoint - C Amundson
Matter set for a Prelim on 08/08/2022 at 3:00 p.m. - Officer is unavailable for 7/25 prelim.
Preliminary hearing on August 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
/s/LJM 6/22/2022 - Approved.
records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Portage County Justice Programs/Referral Form

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess drug paraphernalia.
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances. 
Participate in the Portage County Justice Programs and comply with the requirements for assessment and reporting.

1:33 PM Defendant Justin R. Coyle in court.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Justin R. Coyle. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

State recommends a $2,500 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

2:23 PM Defendant Justin R. Coyle not in court.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Justin R. Coyle. 

Defendant fails to appear.
Court questions Atty Soule as to where her client is.
Atty Soule states that he had been admitted to the hospital.
ADA Pfeil does not oppose.
Atty Soule states that her client has warrants and would like to set if for a return on warrant.

BY THE COURT:
Case is adjourned.
Warrants will remain on all cases that have warrants issued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 20, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
filed by Atty Taylor Soule
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Taylor Soule
Request for Warrant is DENIED as the matter is set for an Adjourned Initial Appearance on 06/06/22 @ 2:15 p.m.

2:06 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin R. Coyle in court. 

Defendant verifies his address. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Defendant does intend to be represented by counsel.  He did an over the phone interview with the Public Defender and he did qualify.  The attorney appointed was Taylor Soule.
Court notes there is not a notice of retainer in the file and asks the defendant if he would like to postpone.
Defendant would like to do that. 
State does not object. 
Court asks the defendant to contact the public defender's office to make sure she was appointed. 
Bond is not set at this time.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Initial Appearance set for May 16, 2022 @ 2:00 p.m. in Br 1
